answers.answer: Certainly a top to bottom physical may be helpful.  Since you want to be proactive, I would suggest Arthur Agatston's book, "The South Beach Heart Program."  He writes about aggressive prevention of heart disease.  The real message is a heart healthy lifestyle, which I believe would be beneficial in many other ways.   With all the stress in your life, I hope you can budget some time for taking care of yourself.

question: I am trying to sleuth out what is going on with me.  I have symptoms all over the place..but not sure what direction to look.  And yes...I've been discussing all these things with my doctor...and I'm going to make another appt.The newest most troubling issues....are my constant numb cold hands at night.  This problem has progressed over the last 5-10 years or so.  I must sleep with my hands below my waist or they become very numb... I often wake up and have to shake them as I can't feel anything in my hands.Also starting 2 weeks ago...I've had acid reflux?  I don't eat late at night...but I've been getting those "vomit burps" at night. Especially if I bend over or move quick at night.  Very nauseaous at night...and mildly during the day...  I have to sleep propped up on my back to reduce symptoms.Very tired all the time...granted I have a high stress life.  We have an autistic child...so we are always on hyper alert.  I just feel like I am aging at an excellerated rate...and I want to be proactive to reduce heart, diabetes, thyroid, cholesterol(mine is 264...and I eat right) issues.  Not sure what direction to focus on first...and what is my main problem....and how are they inter-related...?  Oh I also have a spastic bladder( I pee at least 3-4 times a night..this has always been this way since childhood...they said my bladder was small...they were going to stretch it...), I also have IBS....which hasn't been defined specifically since the last time they wanted to check I was breast feeding and I didn't want all the drugs in me.  I have heart, stroke, and diabetes in my family tree.I just wish I knew a for sure diagnosis so I could focus on it.
title: Mrs. Michelle
